Description: Pottery lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with four small crosses radiating from filling-hole. Shoulder decorated with alternating crosses (6) and rosettes (4); below is a row of raised points. Undefined base. Brown clay, with mica and fine straw temper covered with a red-brown slip and burnt specifically around the spout. A wick survives inside. Base to top of handle: 4.1cm Middle height: 2.6cm Width spout to handle: 8.2cm Spout exterior diameter 2.1cm Adams Type P1 (1986 fig. 61). Classic Christian.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2216)
